"Stand still, and see the salvation of the Lord" (Exodus 14:13)

God says this to believers when they face big troubles and hard situations. You can't go back. You can't move forward. You're trapped on all sides. What should you do?

üôè God says: "Stand still." When things get tough, listen only to God. Other voices will try to confuse you:

üòî Despair says: "Give up! It's hopeless!" But God wants us to be brave and trust His love.

üò® Fear says: "Go back! Being a Christian is too hard!" But if you belong to God, you can't turn back. He has called you to grow stronger.

üèÉ Hurry says: "Do something! Don't just wait!" But we should look to God who will do everything needed.

ü§™ Pride says: "Just charge ahead! God will do a miracle!" But faith listens only to God who says "Stand still."

‚è≥ "Stand still" means be ready like a soldier waiting for orders. Stay cheerful and patient. Soon God will tell you clearly - just like He told Israel - "Go forward!"

üå§Ô∏è "Be quiet! Why worry so much?

God knows your path - every touch.

He makes you fast or makes you slow,

Walk by faith - this you must know.

Trust a while, though dark the night,

Soon He'll make all clear and bright."

üí≠ When you're unsure - wait! If you feel any doubt - wait! Don't force yourself to act. If something inside says "stop," wait until everything becomes clear.
